data.question: What is the formula of the inclusion compound discussed in the text?
What is the V/Co ratio in the inclusion compound [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V)?
What is the main vibrational band of the FT-IR spectrum of [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V)?
What does the absence of any vibrational band in the region 750–790 cm-1 indicate?
data.answer: All of the incorporated cobaltocene molecules are oxidized.

data.question: What is the Néel temperature of the inclusion compound [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V)?
What is the experimental effective magnetic momentum for [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V)?
What is the main reason for the significant contraction of the cell volume in [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V) compared to guest-free MIL-47(V)?
data.answer: Unusually strong host–guest interactions due to electrostatic forces.

data.question: Why is the MIL-47(V) framework considered very rigid?
data.answer: It does not allow large changes of the cell volume like MIL-53(Al) does.

data.question: What does the ESR spectrum of [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V) reveal about the framework reduction?
data.answer: The strong signal of the S = 1/2 spin system of MIL-47(V) is absent, indicating framework reduction.

data.question: What configuration is thermodynamically most favorable for the MIL-47(VIV/VIII) structure according to DFT calculations?
What is the main reason for the preferred uptake of cobaltocene over ferrocene by MIL-47(V)?
data.answer: Charge transfer between the host framework and the guest molecule.

data.question: Does the inclusion compound [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V) exhibit antiferromagnetic behavior?
Is the MIL-47(V) framework more flexible than MIL-53(Al)?
Can cobaltocene be desorbed from [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V) below its decomposition temperature?
Does MIL-53(Al) show a preference for ferrocene over cobaltocene?
Is the cobaltocenium guest easily released from [(h5-C5H5)2Co]0.5@MIL-47(V) by simple washing with water?
